title.narrative: Salomon (les Îles): Aide ciblée aux pays
Solomon Islands: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Cette activité détaille notre travail sur le Aide ciblée aux pays en Salomon (les Îles), grâce à la mise à disposition des données budgétaires et des transactions. Nous fournissons également les documents pertinents qui guident ces activités que sont les formulaires de demande de soutien fournis par le gouvernement de Salomon (les Îles) ainsi que les lettres de décisions émises par Gavi, pour progresser. Ces documents décrivent les activités, les objectifs ainsi que les bénéficiaires.

This activity details our work on Targeted country assistance in Solomon Islands through the provision of budget and transaction data. We also provide the relevant documents that guide these activities, which are the support request proposal(s) provided by the Government of Solomon Islands, as well as the decision letter(s) issued by Gavi, for progress. These documents describe the activities, the objectives as well as the beneficiaries.

title.narrative: PATH : Vaccine-Specific Support
Participation in JA completed

target.value: Participate in Gavi's annual Joint Appraisal and grant renewal processes to ensure continuity of HPV TA support

title.narrative: Review of HPV data improvements conducted with DHIS manager; plan for implementing improvements outlined

target.value: Work with DHIS manager to improve data recording and reporting for HPV and other new vaccines

title.narrative: No reporting or low performing facilities and zones identified from DHIS data review

target.value: Assist with identification of low performing areas for HPV vaccines (in 2021) and other new vaccines introduced (MSD, IPV, rota) in 2022

title.narrative: Mentoring and monitoring provided to areas implementing coverage improvement plans, using DHIS reported data review to track progress

target.value: Assist with monitoring and mentoring activities with provinces/zones to implement coverage improvement plans for HPV (in 2021) or other new vaccine coverage (MSD, IPV, rota), with focus on those zero-dose or missing follow-up doses

title.narrative: DHIS data of HPV reporting reviewed by province, zone, and facility

target.value: Monitor progress of HPV vaccine rollout through data review in DHIS and direct follow up with provinces, zones, facilities

title.narrative: Support to HCC provided and HPV vaccinations restarted

target.value: Provide direct support to HCC to restart HPV vaccinations (dose 2 MAC and dose 1 new cohort)

title.narrative: Assistance provided to implement and monitor HPV, MSD and other recently new vaccines introduced

target.value: Technical support to EPI coordinator for new vaccine introductions (HPV, MSD, IPV), with focus in 2021 on HPV and other new vaccines in 2022

title.narrative: Coverage improvement plans developed for identified low performing HPV areas or areas of vaccine hesitancy

target.value: Work with low performing areas and/or areas of vaccine hesitancy in 2021 to develop coverage improvement plans for HPV, and in 2022 for all new vaccines (MSD, IPV, rota, in addition to HPV)

title.narrative: Support provided to MHMS on integration plans

target.value: Technical support to MHMS to integrate HPV into routine activities of EPI, post-HPV dose 2 (2020)

title.narrative: Participation in initial dose 2 review meetings completed

target.value: Technical support to MHMS to monitor HPV dose 2 implemention progress, identify challenges, propose solutions (2020)

title.narrative: World Bank : Programme Management - Financial Management
(i) NUI AOP&B for 2021 is linked to Provincial AOP&B, and on-system and off-system contributions are included in the original MHMS budget.

target.value: Targeted support to build capacity for planning and budgeting, execution and oversight will assist MHMS to implement more effective vaccination programs that deliver the results expected. In addition, activities to support MHMS with its efforts to clarify roles and responsibilities between national and provincial programs will clearly benefit the EPI program. This includes improving quality of AOP&B both at national and provincial levels (including supporting the AOP&Bs with the gradual transition of Gavi on-system) and building capacity to shape stronger links between national and provincial AOP&B and supporting provincial divisions to get resources to lower level facilities. In supporting MHMS track financing pressures to the health sector, provide TA and analytical assistance to update the Medium Term Expenditure Pressures Note. This will include supporting MHMS have a clearer picture of resource allocation and use across MHMS and the Provincial Divisions, including for the immunization program, to help support MHMS manage health financing pressures (including from Gavi transition) and inform annual AOP&Bs.

Targeted support to build capacity for planning and budgeting, execution and oversight will assist MHMS to implement more effective vaccination programs that deliver the results expected. In addition, activities to support MHMS with its efforts to clarify roles and responsibilities between national and provincial programs will clearly benefit the EPI program. This includes improving quality of AOP&B both at national and provincial levels (including supporting the AOP&Bs with the gradual transition of Gavi on-system) and building capacity to shape stronger links between national and provincial AOP&B and supporting provincial divisions to get resources to lower level facilities. In supporting MHMS track financing pressures to the health sector, provide TA and analytical assistance to update the Medium Term Expenditure Pressures Note. This will include supporting MHMS have a clearer picture of resource allocation and use across MHMS and the Provincial Divisions, including for the immunization program, to help support MHMS manage health financing pressures (including from Gavi transition) and inform annual AOP&Bs.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Vaccines security strengthened with timely forecast completed and submitted.

target.value: Technical assistance and accompaniment provided to MHMS on; EPI programme management and implementation, Rotavirus vaccine introduction, EVM implementation, HSS & vaccine renewal requests, Joint appraisal updates to facilitate the transition process from Gavi, and vaccines security for the EPI program.

Technical assistance and accompaniment provided to MHMS on; EPI programme management and implementation, Rotavirus vaccine introduction, EVM implementation, HSS & vaccine renewal requests, Joint appraisal updates to facilitate the transition process from Gavi, and vaccines security for the EPI program.

title.narrative: World Bank : Financial/General Management

(i) Annual Ministerial budget and expenditure and trend analysis (BETA) and the spending pressures note (MTEP) are completed and opportunities for more effective use of resources, and to inform planning and budget preparation processes within the Ministry; (ii) draft costing of EPI program to inform annual AOP&B and budget submissions for 2022 including to inform the discussions around transition to domestic financing upon graduation

target.value: (i) Continue to support MHMS with improving the quality of AOP&B both at national and provincial levels and building capacity to shape stronger links between national and provincial AOP&B for the budget process submission (ii) Continue to support MHMS track financing pressures to the health sector, by updating the Medium Term Expenditure Pressures Note, and the budget and expenditure tracking analysis for MHMS (including for the immunization program) to have a clearer picture of resource allocation and use across MHMS, the national division and the Provincial Divisions (iii) Continue to support the MHMS with the transition of the financing of the immunization program from off-system (outside government system) to on-system (using the government financial management system) (iv) Continue with other partners to engage in dialogue/analysis with MHMS regarding the need and options for increased domestic financing in preparation for when the country graduates from GAVI financing in 2023

title.narrative: (i) National immunization program AOP&B for 2021 is completed and is linked to Provincial AOP&B and (ii) Complete provincial funding transition to on-system with initial review and analysis of budget and expenditure execution, inlcuding higlighting challenges and changes in financing flow and the impact on service delivery in the provinces (now having transitioned to on-system)

target.value: (i) Continue to support MHMS with improving the quality of AOP&B both at national and provincial levels and building capacity to shape stronger links between national and provincial AOP&B for the budget process submission (ii) Continue to support MHMS track financing pressures to the health sector, by updating the Medium Term Expenditure Pressures Note, and the budget and expenditure tracking analysis for MHMS (including for the immunization program) to have a clearer picture of resource allocation and use across MHMS, the national division and the Provincial Divisions (iii) Continue to support the MHMS with the transition of the financing of the immunization program from off-system (outside government system) to on-system (using the government financial management system) (iv) Continue with other partners to engage in dialogue/analysis with MHMS regarding the need and options for increased domestic financing in preparation for when the country graduates from GAVI financing in 2023

title.narrative: WHO : Policy & Regulatory Environment

i. Subject to MHMS prioritization the EPI team and Transition Plan are being utilized to leverage mutual beneficial changes for the programme and overall advancement of RDP, through health system building blocks alignment with EPI bottlenecks. ii. Family Health Committee (FHC) and MHMS /DP SWAp mechanism are utilized where possible for coordination of DP activities in implementation of Transition Plan, and more broadly alignment with MHMS policies. iii. Continued support to MHMS Executive in advocacy strategy through Solomon Islands Government budget process, for investments necessary for sustainable provision of EPI programme through and beyond transition plan.

target.value: Provide the overarching HSS capacity to support the MHMS in the MHMS/GAVI Transition Plan for a successful transition. In this multi year activity; MHMS executive team and Provincial Directors and management supported in restructure of service delivery platform in alignment with the Role DelinaeationPolicy. Linkages made between implementation bottlenecks across the HSS and CCEOP and with the MHSM broader reforms, and focus on strengthening integrated service delivery. Identification of governance mechanisms to improve fiscal allocations to the health sector. PCU or other MHMS mechanism supported to monitor relevant MHMS departments for Gavi Transition activities.

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Reports on national and subnational Rota vaccine data for vaccination coverage and related lessons learnt during introduction campaign.

Continue technical support fto the MHMS on timely EPI implementation, linkage an intergration within RMNCAH activities. Rota coverage report and RCM activities are taking place. JA submitted and reporting on GAVI portal for all technical activities in TCA.

target.value: Support preparation and review of EPI programme with wide stakeholder consultation and input, prepare TORs related to incoming consultant for technical support. Coordinate the EPI review TA and support the linkage of the EPI review with historical review processes and future strategic planning and development of EPI Strategy for 2020-2025 and contribute to EPI priorities within the NHSP process. Solomon Islands Comprehensive Multi Year Plan (cMYP) draft initiated and consultation meetings supported. Technical support to the MHMS for Annual Operations activities planning and support on timely EPI implementation, linkage and intergration within RMNCAH programme and support coordination at the ICC/Family Health. Analytical assistance of DHIS2 data and data generated as part of MHMS review processes, the JRF data, JA document and new vaccine introductions. Support and technical advice for pandemic preparedness and surveillance activities.

Support preparation and review of EPI programme with wide stakeholder consultation and input, prepare TORs related to incoming consultant for technical support. Coordinate the EPI review TA and support the linkage of the EPI review with historical review processes and future strategic planning and development of EPI Strategy for 2020-2025 and contribute to EPI priorities within the NHSP process. Solomon Islands Comprehensive Multi Year Plan (cMYP) draft initiated and consultation meetings supported. Technical support to the MHMS for Annual Operations activities planning and support on timely EPI implementation, linkage and intergration within RMNCAH programme and support coordination at the ICC/Family Health. Analytical assistance of DHIS2 data and data generated as part of MHMS review processes, the JRF data, JA document and new vaccine introductions. Support and technical advice for pandemic preparedness and surveillance activities.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
Service delivery related barriers of missed communities to access immunisation services identified and prioritized

target.value: Technical assistance and accompaniment provided to MHMS on; sustainable EPI programme management and implementation, EVM implementation, HSS & vaccine renewal requests and reporting, Multistakeholder dialogue updates to facilitate the transition process from Gavi, and vaccines security for the EPI program in view of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Technical assistance and accompaniment provided to MHMS on; sustainable EPI programme management and implementation, EVM implementation, HSS & vaccine renewal requests and reporting, Multistakeholder dialogue updates to facilitate the transition process from Gavi, and vaccines security for the EPI program in view of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.narrative: Roadmap for improved integration of EPI with other PHC services

target.value: Assist the MHMS and EPi program to udate the routne immuniztaion microplans, strengthening routine immunization outreaches and supervision with broader integration of PHC services

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
% of target sites achieving readiness to receive cold chain (e.g. equipment on site, ready and w/ trained staff).

target.value: Facilitate the implementation of EVM recommendations to improve the immunization and broader PHC supply chain; and implementation of the vaccine wastage reduction strategy through dedicated technical assistance

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
Quarterly reporting of subnational stock data from at least 3 provinces available.

target.value: Immunization supply chain strengthening through (a) strengthening subnational stock management (b) facilitate incorporation of VVM and vaccine wastage data into Msupply (c) explore vaccine waste management plan for 2 provinces (d) implementing action points from the vaccine wastage reduction strategy (e) post-installation inspection (PII) for installed equipment under the CCEOP, and (f) comprehensive cold chain inventory assessment reflecting the newly installed cold chain equipmen

Immunization supply chain strengthening through (a) strengthening subnational stock management (b) facilitate incorporation of VVM and vaccine wastage data into Msupply (c) explore vaccine waste management plan for 2 provinces (d) implementing action points from the vaccine wastage reduction strategy (e) post-installation inspection (PII) for installed equipment under the CCEOP, and (f) comprehensive cold chain inventory assessment reflecting the newly installed cold chain equipmen

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Update report with successes and lessons learnt

target.value: Programme monitoring support for the effective implementation of the Gavi CSO grant for immunization demand generation activities in targeted communities.
Programme monitoring support for the effective implementation of the Gavi CSO grant for immunization demand generation activities in targeted communities.

title.narrative: NGO/CSO mapping developed

target.value: Provide programme monitoring and technical assurance to the implementation of the CSO demand generation project in four provinces being implemented by World Vision

title.narrative: Communication and social mobilization strategy developed

target.value: Social mobilization for EPI covering (a) continued implementation of immunization and child health communication strategy (b) evaluate and update communication plan and materials to reflect additional pandemic response challenges

title.narrative: Updated EPI comms strategy implementation plan

target.value: Social mobilization for EPI covering (a) rotavirus introduction communication plan and materials (c) continued implementation of immunization and child health communication strategy
Social mobilization for EPI covering (a) rotavirus introduction communication plan and materials (c) continued implementation of immunization and child health communication strategy

title.narrative: WHO : Vaccine-Specific Support

In country SSA staff support for continued surveillance strengthening and RO Staff to provide technical support to the country (as needed) for ongoing surveillance assessments to strengthen reporting. Monthly surveillance report on AFP and AFR, supervision and training of the current sentinel sites. Support for new AEFI reporting systems and trainings.

target.value: Strengthening VPDs? surveillance including case-based national surveillance with focus on acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) and acute fever and rash (AFR). SSA in country support and RO Staff travel (when required ) to provide technical support to the country for ongoing surveillance assessment, logistics for the lab testing of samples. Organize training for staff when needed. Coordinate with global and regional reference labs for results troubleshooting, interpretation, reconfirmation.

title.narrative: Monthly and Quarterly reports will be available. Continuous support to the Surveillance Unit in the EPI unit by the SSA. Sentinel sites provided with staff trainings to support reporting and case diagnosis. Additional support for new AEFI reporting system and review DHIS2 new AEFI module data and follows-up.

target.value: Strengthening VPDs? surveillance including case-based national surveillance with focus on acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) and acute fever and rash (AFR). SSA in country support and RO Staff travel (when required ) to provide technical support to the country for ongoing surveillance assessment, logistics for the lab testing of samples. Organize training for staff when needed. Coordinate with global and regional reference labs for results troubleshooting, interpretation, reconfirmation.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)
Monthly and Quarterly reports will be available. Continuous support to the Surveillance Unit in the EPI unit by the SSA, and the RO. Sentinel sites expanded with staff trainngs to support.

target.value: Strengthening VPDs? surveillance including case-based national surveillance with focus on acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) and acute fever and rash (AFR). SSA in country support and RO Staff travel (when required ) to provide technical support to the country for ongoing surveillance assessment, logistics for the lab testing of samples. Organize training for staff when needed. Coordinate with global and regional reference labs for results troubleshooting, interpretation, reconfirmation. Expand sentinel sites to 1 low performing zone (Guadalcanal) and 1 border site in proximity to PNG.

Strengthening VPDs? surveillance including case-based national surveillance with focus on acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) and acute fever and rash (AFR). SSA in country support and RO Staff travel (when required ) to provide technical support to the country for ongoing surveillance assessment, logistics for the lab testing of samples. Organize training for staff when needed. Coordinate with global and regional reference labs for results troubleshooting, interpretation, reconfirmation. Expand sentinel sites to 1 low performing zone (Guadalcanal) and 1 border site in proximity to PNG.

title.narrative: EPI and RMNCAH data collection is integrated into HIS of the MHMS according to the Digital Health Strategy. Mobile data collection piloted. Initial reports generated.

target.value: Technical Assistance provided to support MHMS Health Information Systems, with the goal of sustaining past gains and to further strengthen the national HIS, including the development of digital health strategy> This will include capacity building for more advanced data analysis and data sharing between platforms ? resulting in improved quality and timely information for decision making. Support will include complementary initiatives to improve EPI case based information.

Technical Assistance provided to support MHMS Health Information Systems, with the goal of sustaining past gains and to further strengthen the national HIS, including the development of digital health strategy> This will include capacity building for more advanced data analysis and data sharing between platforms ? resulting in improved quality and timely information for decision making. Support will include complementary initiatives to improve EPI case based information.

title.narrative: WHO : Service Delivery

1) Based on MHMS prioritization, the EPI Team will use the Transition Plan to leverage resources necessary to bring about changes that benifit the Programme and enhance the overall advancement of RDP. Guided by the system building blocks alignment with All activies require to minimize EPI bottlenecks will be alligned with the System Building Blocks.. 2) Support the development and advancement of further integrated frameworks and systems that can help the Program to: measure progress and meaningfully inform the pursuit of national health and development goals; focus on the generation, analysis and use of metrics that are relevant to policy-makin; and guide implementation and resource allocation at all levels, Collecting EPI. Disaggregated data will also be essential to determinr where health inequities exist and to address health issues in an equitable manner.

1) Following successful development of the new NHSP, advocacy for having relevant EPI programme recommendations integrated in wider MHMS strategies including the NHSP 2022-26 & Digital Health Strategy.. 2) Following advocacy and guidance MHMS, Executives adopt a Strategic Framework to guide the implementation of activiyties needed to meet the short, medium and long term objectives of the Role Delineation Policy ? and highlight the activities included in health system building blocks as priorities for MHMS AOP planning. The Strategic Framework will include the attributes of the health system needed to determine country path to achieving UHC (i.e. ensuring that short-term actions lead to building robust health systems that provide comprehensive coverage of EPI and other services).

1) Following successful development of the new NHSP, advocacy for having relevant EPI programme recommendations integrated in wider MHMS strategies including the NHSP 2022-26 & Digital Health Strategy.. 2) Following advocacy and guidance MHMS, Executives adopt a Strategic Framework to guide the implementation of activiyties needed to meet the short, medium and long term objectives of the Role Delineation Policy ? and highlight the activities included in health system building blocks as priorities for MHMS AOP planning. The Strategic Framework will include the attributes of the health system needed to determine country path to achieving UHC (i.e. ensuring that short-term actions lead to building robust health systems that provide comprehensive coverage of EPI and other services).

target.value: 1) Manage and lead the health systems strengthening interventions related to policy development provision of advisory services to the MHMS and other ministries of Solomon Islands; 2) Support the MHMS to use the recommendations included in the review report of the 2015-2021 to inform the development and finalize a new NHSP for 2022-2026; 3) Support the MHMs develop a national digital health strategy emphasizing Immunization related activities particularly those regarding data collection and sharing on immunization target groups, reporting and notification. 4) Enhance cooperation within MHMS and among health Departments and Units especially the Surveillance and EPI Units. 5) Ensure that immunization key activities and aspects are well presented and prioritized in the new NHSP and that they are in line with Role Delineation Policy (RDP) and comply with its Service Delivery Packages standards; and 6) Support the development and implementation of the Government?s pandemic preparedness and response plan at different strategic levels with accent on immunization and provide all type of technical required to implement the GAVI HSS Grant.

title.narrative: Coordination and management of COVAX related technical support from WHO country TA, DPS and RO. Linkage and intergration with COVAX activities that can be leveraged for routine immunization - specifically the proposed DHIS2 tracker module and its roll-out.Technical support provided to the EPI review process, continue to develop linkages to EPI Regional strategic plan (WHO and GVAP), support finalization of the draft cMYP (Comprehensive Multi-Year Plan) 2021-2025

target.value: Technical support in finalizing draft cMYP with MHMS and partners - linkages to EPI Regional strategic plan (WHO and GVAP), consultant planning and technical support to the MHMS for Annual Operations activities planning. Support linkage and intergration within DHIS2 and new tracker module for COVAX, expanded to other vaccines, with capacity building for more advanced data analysis and data sharing between platforms ? resulting in improved quality and timely information for decision making. Support new vaccine introduction, including support to IPV second dose and continued strenghtening of HPV, Rota and MR second dose.

title.narrative: Support for strengthening VPD surveillance and laboratory diagnostics. Molecular laboratory capacity built for conducting range of VPD diagnostics. Countries cMYP 2021-25 submitted for endorsement

target.value: Technical support in finalizing draft cMYP with MHMS and partners - linkages to EPI Regional strategic plan (WHO and GVAP), consultant planning and technical support to the MHMS for Annual Operations activities planning. Support linkage and intergration within DHIS2 and new tracker module for COVAX, expanded to other vaccines, with capacity building for more advanced data analysis and data sharing between platforms ? resulting in improved quality and timely information for decision making. Support new vaccine introduction, including support to IPV second dose and continued strenghtening of HPV, Rota and MR second dose.
